name: GEAR HEAD-PHOTO VIDEO GEAR HEAD-COMPUTER KP2200U 19-KEY NUMERIC KEYPAD BY GEAR

reviews.name: Gear Head 19-Key Numeric Keypad, KP2200U
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this unit because of the price. But am impressed with the limited lifetime warranty.
I only have 2 complaints:
1. the "000" key is worthless for basic financial data entry. And I removed it because I was hitting that key instead of the "0" key.
2. the unit tends to creep foward because the little rubber pads on the bottom are just too small to prevent movement.
reviews.title: a must-have for numeric speed on laptops

reviews.name: Gear Head 19-Key Numeric Keypad, KP2200U
reviews.reviewText: great price, delivered site to store for free, easy to install, very happy with keypad, only one complaint... you have to hit num lock on keypad to use your letters on laptop and then hit num lock again to use numbers on keypad. can get confusing. maybe this could be fixed by changing a setting, i dont know. in some cases this is ok, as in my case i use this laptop to post payments so generally i dont need to type on my laptop. im happy with it for what i paid.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.name: Gear Head 19-Key Numeric Keypad, KP2200U
reviews.reviewText:
This is exactly what we needed to help our son do math homework online. I plugged the USB into the laptop, Vista loaded the right drivers and in about 15 seconds it was installed and working properly. My experience with site to store has been very positive. I paid at time of order with Paypal and it was there when they said it would be.
Overall the product looks and works as advertised and I would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: 28 January 2012

reviews.name: Gear Head 19-Key Numeric Keypad, KP2200U
reviews.reviewText: If the user's wrist angle is natural and straight, the bottom edge of the keypad can prevent the thumb from fully pushing down on the ZERO key. So the wrist needs to be at a slightly higher angle so that the thumb points slightly down in order to get a full push on the ZERO key.
reviews.title: Good product with one small flaw

reviews.name: Gear Head 19-Key Numeric Keypad, KP2200U
reviews.reviewText: I tried the Targus keypad and didn't like it at all. The soft touch keys made it difficult to tell if I had hit the key or not. And it didn't have the full 19 keys that this one does. I'm happy with this keypad and will be keeping it.
reviews.title: Good Keypad!
